node.title: At least 50 catch Omicron COVID variant at Norwegian Christmas party
node.alt: People sit in a COVID-19 mass vaccination centre.
node.description: The city of Oslo is urging people who visited two restaurants in the capital to be tested after 50 people who attended a party in one of the venues later tested positive to the Omicron variant of COVID-19.
node.content:
["At least 50 people in Norway have the Omicron variant after attending a workplace Christmas party in an Oslo restaurant.", "The Norwegian Institute of Public Health said that those affected live in Oslo and surrounding municipalities, and \"the infection detection team in Oslo has contacted the municipalities concerned\" to start contact tracing.", "On Wednesday, the City of Oslo urged people who visited two restaurants in the capital to be tested.", "One, reportedly, was where the Christmas party was held.", "It is customary in Scandinavia for companies, associations and individuals to hold Christmas parties in the weeks leading up to Christmas Eve.", "The government agency said that there was \"a high vaccination coverage\" in the group, adding that overall \"more than 50 cases\" of the Omicron variant have been recorded in Norway.", "On Monday, the country's first two cases on the new variant were announced.", "\"More cases are expected,\" the Oslo Municipality said in a statement.\u00a0\"Effective tracing is being done to limit transmission routes and prevent major outbreaks.\"", "In response to Omicron, however, the Norwegian government said new national and regional restrictions would take effect on\u00a0Friday.", "Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Stoere said the strictest measures were regional and would apply to Oslo \u2014 a city of nearly 700,000 people \u2014 as well as to\u00a0surrounding municipalities.", "He said they included working from home when possible, a 100-person attendance limit at private indoor events in public places or rented venues, and restaurants and bars having to register patrons.", "Nationally, anyone entering Norway must be tested within 24 hours, either at the border, at a public test station or by self-test.", "If a rapid test comes back positive, a traveller must take a PCR test within 24 hours, the government said.", "On Tuesday, Norway recommended the use of face masks on public transportation and in shops and shopping malls.", "\"It is likely that the Omicron variant will spread in Norway, and that is why the government believes in stricter measures,\" Mr Gahr Stoere said.", "\"We still have to keep our distance to get control of the spread of infection, but that does not mean that we cannot have good contact with each other.\"", "AP", "", "
Heavily mutated Omicron variant puts scientist on alert
"]
